image.altText: Dairy cows stand behind a fence.

props.synopsis: New technology allowing livestock to be remotely moved via electronic collars has been legalised in SA. Industry says virtual fencing has the potential to save animals and even human lives.

title.children: Emerging virtual fencing tech could help save cattle trapped in bushfires

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking in an interview in a concerned manner

props.synopsis: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

title.children: SA Labor stalwart and former federal minister Nick Bolkus dies

image.altText: Peter Drew pastes up a poster

props.synopsis: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

title.children: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti

image.altText: A man holding a cricket shirt in front of a beach.

props.synopsis: They travelled on horse and cart and were smuggled on a boat for three months to England, the story of the First XI Aboriginal cricket team is being remembered as a descendant presents the Boxing Day medal.

title.children: 'They were a band of brothers': The largely untold story of Australia's first touring cricket team

image.altText: A blonde woman in a black T-shirt with a cliff and ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: For decades, pregnancy was seen as an "injury" that could end a career. But now, determination and growing industry support are seeing marathon-running mothers reach new heights after giving birth.

title.children: The women competing in marathons and breaking records after giving birth

image.altText: A young Kamahl fronting his television show with the ABC orchestra

props.synopsis: At 91, Malaysian-born Australian entertainment legend Kamahl reflects on his life and career.

title.children: Kamahl reflects on his life and career as he finishes likely final recording

image.altText: Woman wearing colouful top and apron stands smiling in her kitchen with cakes wrapped in colourful paper on bench next to her

props.synopsis: As households across the world sit down to enjoy a festive feast, Faye Taylor revels in knowing 500 of her traditional Christmas cakes are bringing enjoyment and helping raise funds for people in need.

title.children: Faye's great Christmas cake baking mission

image.altText: A Santa Claus sitting on a throne surrounded by presents at kids festival

props.synopsis: South Australia's Christmas traditions have evolved from the days of John Martin's Magic Cave. So, can the state lay claim to being the most festive in Australia?

title.children: Is South Australia the most festive state?

image.altText: A woman and a black labrador dog stand in front of a vast outback landscape

props.synopsis: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

title.children: Seeing eye dog Mika is helping station owner navigate life on the land

image.altText: A women holds up four different types of frozen prawns in bags

props.synopsis: New research shows younger Aussies prefer to save time and mess by buying pre-peeled prawns over the festive season.

title.children: Peeled or whole? How we buy prawns reveals a growing generational divide

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression and black hair takes a selfie

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

title.children: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail

image.altText: A smiling woman sitting at a desk.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

title.children: Woman accused of trying to kill ex allegedly searched for 'hit men'

image.altText: Bonfires lit along a river as people drive by to catch a glimpse.

props.synopsis: From Bethlehem to Beijing, people around the world have been celebrating Christmas in their own traditional way.

title.children: Christmas celebrations around the world in photos

image.altText: An opened box of silver tube-like detonators on top of a red file on the table

props.synopsis: A man has been charged after police allegedly seized explosive detonators and three unregistered firearms among other weapons from his property in Adelaide's north.

title.children: Weapons, detonators allegedly found in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A vehicle with a Happy Chanukah! sign that has sustained fire damage.

props.synopsis: Officers in Melbourne's south continue to investigate an arson attack on a car with a Hanukkah decoration in the early hours of Christmas morning.

title.children: Police name person of interest in search for Hanukkah car arsonist

image.altText: close up of social media apps on iphone screen including facebook, messenger, tiktok, instagram, threads and whatsapp

props.synopsis: A US judge temporarily blocks the Trump administration from detaining a British man over his work combating online hate and disinformation.

title.children: US judge blocks deportation of anti-disinformation activist

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk holding a black folder open with yellow-gold curtains and two flags behind him.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he ordered a "powerful and deadly strike against ISIS terrorist scum" for targeting Christians at levels not seen for years.

title.children: Trump launches strikes against Islamic State militants in Nigeria

image.altText: A single jet flying in the sky, pictured from a level altitude.

props.synopsis: Poland has warned several incidents regarding airspace during the holiday season may signal a provocation.

title.children: Poland intercepts Russian plane, reports airspace breaches from Belarus

image.altText: A car is buried in mud and rubble, next to a wooden structure and trees.

props.synopsis: State authorities have declared a state of emergency in several counties, including Los Angeles.

title.children: Man killed by falling tree as three die in floods and mudslides in California

image.altText: A young man leaves court.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old Canberra man accused of performing Nazi salutes in public and spreading extremist propaganda has been released on strict bail conditions after spending Christmas Day in custody.

title.children: Teenager accused of Nazi salutes granted bail in ACT court

image.altText: A sign pointing to the remote community of Laramba with 2km next to it.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are investigating after a 35-year-old man was stabbed to death in a small town north-west of Alice Springs on Friday.

title.children: Police investigating Boxing Day stabbing death north of Alice Springs

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese walks down the aisle with his now wife Jodie Haydon.

props.synopsis: The new year is fast approaching and it's naturally got ABC journalists reflecting on the year that's been. But how much of it do you remember?

title.children: Were you paying attention to the news cycle this year?

image.altText: SanaeTakaichi gestures as she speaks into a microphone at a lectern

props.synopsis: Japan's cabinet approves a record defence budget plan aiming to fortify its strike-back capability and coastal defence amid rising regional tensions.

title.children: Japan okays record defence budget amid rising tensions with China

image.altText: The exterior of the law courts in the ACT

props.synopsis: A 39-year-old man has been remanded in custody after police allege he fired multiple shots at officers during a Christmas Eve incident in Canberra's north.

title.children: Man charged with assaulting pregnant woman, shooting at police

image.altText: A composite image of three different baked goods in front of Australian scenery.

props.synopsis: Kazuaki Ono wanted to entice people from Japan to visit Australia by showing we have as much to offer with our food culture as we do with our iconic scenery.

title.children: This photographer visited 24 Australian bakeries to showcase our love of bread

image.altText: An out of focus woman gazes at a stem of grass in the foreground

props.synopsis: Much-loved by locals and bringing in more than 250,000 visitors a year, Litchfield National Park has become one of the Northern Territory's star attractions. But it's under threat from a near-invisible invader.

title.children: Iconic Top End national park under threat from near-invisible invader

image.altText: The jackpot for the Powerball lottery game is displayed on a sign.

props.synopsis: The winning ticket was sold at a Murphy USA in Cabot, lottery officials in Arkansas said on Thursday, local time.

title.children: US Powerball lottery jackpot pays out $2.7 billion on Christmas Eve

image.altText: A boy dressed as an elf sits on a man's shoulders as they pass a well-lit Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: Istanbul's prosecutor general says intelligence picked up on plans for potential Islamic State attacks during the end-of-year holiday period.

title.children: Türkiye detains 115 alleged IS members planning 'Christmas attacks'

image.altText: A man in a grey jacket and white collared shirt smiles in front of a crowd dressed in blue shirts that say "Tim Wilson".

props.synopsis: In a broad ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, Liberal MP Tim Wilson speaks about what the Liberal Party should be fighting for and why he would one day like to be its leader.

title.children: Tim Wilson believes 'most' Liberal MPs would be untroubled by gay leader

image.altText: A man with a fine crop and in a black shirt looks away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Sergei Udaltsov, the leader of the Left Front movement that opposes President Vladimir Putin, was arrested last year.

title.children: Putin critic and pro-war activist jailed by Russian court

image.altText: Britain's King Charles III during the recording of his Christmas message

props.synopsis: King Charles III pays homage to those who confronted terror at the Bondi Beach massacre, acknowledging their "spontaneous acts of bravery" in his annual Christmas message.

title.children: King praises acts of 'spontaneous bravery' in Christmas message

image.altText: People help themselves to trays of food. Volunteers in bright jackets hand them out.

props.synopsis: For almost six years, Aunty's Free Feeds has been serving home-cooked meals to anybody who needs them from a pop-up buffet in the car park of a swimming pool.

title.children: Feeding the hungry in the car park of a suburban swimming pool

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios smiles

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios remains one of Australian tennis' biggest names, but, according to Mark Philippoussis, there are clear pros and cons to offering him a wildcard berth for the Australian Open.

title.children: Why Aus Open organisers will be torn on Kyrgios's wildcard berth

image.altText: Shoppers looking at items.

props.synopsis: The Australian Retailers Association is predicting a 4 per cent rise in spending in the Boxing Day sales, despite tough economic conditions.

title.children: Shoppers hit Boxing Day sales amid record spending prediction

image.altText: Pope Leo stands on a balcony flanked by two cardinals.

props.synopsis: During his Urbi et Orbi (city and world) speech on Christmas Day, Pope Leo XIV has called for an end to all wars and for people to think about the conditions in Gaza.

title.children: Pope Leo asks people to think about Gaza during Christmas Day speech
